activities.loc: Parties to appear remotely via Zoom (SC-1016)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J Meeuwsen

records.addlTxt: to the Court filed by Atty. Charles Blumenfield regarding discovery demand and pretrial offer.

9:11 AM Defendant Michael J Meeuwsen in court.  Attorney Charles S. Blumenfield in court for Michael J Meeuwsen. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. 
Defense has not yet received discovery or an offer at this time. 
State to email offer to Atty Blumenfield. 
Parties may appear by zoom for the next hearing.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:53 AM Defendant Michael J Meeuwsen in court with attorney Charles S. Blumenfield.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Request to adjourn court date.
  **Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 07-08-2022. "This request is denied unless the court receives WRITTEN VERIFICATION from both the Assistant District Attorney AS WELL AS Victim Witness's Office indicating there is no objection from the Victim."
